model.chip_description: Product Features • ARM Cortex-M3 CPU platform • High Performance 32-bit processor @ up to 32 MHz • Memory Protection Unit • Wake-up Interrupt Controller • Flexible Energy Management System • 20 nA @ 3 V Shutoff Mode • 0.6 μA @ 3 V Stop Mode, including Power-on Reset, Brown-out Detector, RAM and CPU retention • 0.9 μA @ 3 V Deep Sleep Mode, including Real Time Clock with 32.768 kHz oscillator, Power-on Reset, Brown-out Detector, RAM and CPU retention • 45 μA/MHz @ 3 V Sleep Mode • 180 μA/MHz @ 3 V Run Mode, with code executed from flash • 128/64/32 KB Flash • 16/16/8 KB RAM • 90 General Purpose I/O pins • Configurable Push-pull, Open-drain, pull-up/down, input filter, drive strength • Configurable peripheral I/O locations • 16 asynchronous external interrupts • 8 Channel DMA Controller • 8 Channel Peripheral Reflex System for autonomous inter-peripheral signaling • Hardware AES with 128/256-bit keys in 54/75 cycles • Timers/Counters • 3× 16-bit Timer/Counter • 3×3 Compare/Capture/PWM channels • Dead-Time Insertion on TIMER0 • 16-bit Low Energy Timer • 24-bit Real-Time Counter • 3× 8-bit Pulse Counter • Asynchronous pulse counting/quadrature decoding • Watchdog Timer with dedicated RC oscillator @ 50 nA • Integrated LCD Controller for up to 4×40 segments • Voltage boost, adjustable contrast adjustment and autonomous animation feature • External Bus Interface for up to 64 MB of external memory mapped space • Communication interfaces • 3× Universal Synchronous/Asynchronous Receiver/ Transmitter • UART/SPI/SmartCard (ISO 7816)/IrDA • Triple buffered full/half-duplex operation • 4-16 data bits • Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter • Triple buffered full/half-duplex operation • 8-9 data bits • 2× Low Energy UART • Autonomous operation with DMA in Deep Sleep Mode • I2C Interface with SMBus support • Address recognition in Stop Mode • Ultra low power precision analog peripherals • 12-bit 1 Msamples/s Analog to Digital Converter • 8 single ended channels/4 differential channels • On-chip temperature sensor • Conversion tailgating for predictable latency • 12-bit 500 ksamples/s Digital to Analog Converter • 2 single ended channels/1 differential channel • 2× Analog Comparator • Programmable speed/current • Capacitive sensing with up to 8 inputs • Supply Voltage Comparator • Ultra efficient Power-on Reset and Brown-Out Detector • 2-pin Serial Wire Debug interface • 1-pin Serial Wire Viewer • Pre-Programmed Serial Bootloader • Temperature range -40 to 85 ºC • Single power supply 1.8 to 3.8 V • BGA112/QFN32/QFN64/QFP100 packages Copyright © 2011 Energy Micro AS. All rights reserved.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Read Mode - Value, Description 0x00, WS0 - Zero wait-states inserted in fetch or read transfers 0x01, WS1 - One wait-state inserted for each fetch or read transfer. This mode is required for a core frequency above 16 MHz. 0x02, WS0SCBTP - Zero wait-states inserted with the Suppressed Conditional Branch Target Prefetch (SCBTP) function enabled. SCBTP saves energy by delaying Cortex-M3 conditional branch target prefetches until the conditional branch instruction is in the execute stage. When the instruction reaches this stage, the evaluation of the branch condition is completed and the core does not perform a speculative prefetch of both the branch target address and the next sequential address. With the SCBTP function enabled, one instruction fetch is saved for each branch not taken, with a negligible performance penalty. 0x03, WS1SCBTP - One wait-state access with SCBTP enabled.

field.description: Brown Out Detector Unregulated Domain Reset

field.name: BODREGRST
field.description: Brown Out Detector Regulated Domain Reset

field.name: HFXOMODE
field.description: HFXO Mode - Value, Description 0x00, XTAL - 4-32 MHz crystal oscillator 0x01, BUFEXTCLK - An AC coupled buffer is coupled in series with HFXTAL_N, suitable for external sine wave (4-32 MHz). The sine wave should have a minimum of 200mV peak to peak. 0x02, DIGEXTCLK - Digital external clock on HFXTAL_N pin. Oscillator is effectively bypassed.

field.name: HFXOBOOST
field.description: HFXO Start-up Boost Current - Value, Description 0x00, 50PCENT - 50 % 0x01, 70PCENT - 70 % 0x02, 80PCENT - 80 % 0x03, 100PCENT - 100 % (default)

field.name: HFXOTIMEOUT
field.description: HFXO Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 8CYCLES - Timeout period of 8 cycles 0x01, 256CYCLES - Timeout period of 256 cycles 0x02, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x03, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles

field.name: LFXOMODE
field.description: LFXO Mode - Value, Description 0x00, XTAL - 32.768 kHz crystal oscillator 0x01, BUFEXTCLK - An AC coupled buffer is coupled in series with LFXTAL_N pin, suitable for external sinus wave (32.768 kHz). 0x02, DIGEXTCLK - Digital external clock on LFXTAL_N pin. Oscillator is effectively bypassed.

field.name: LFXOTIMEOUT
field.description: LFXO Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, 8CYCLES - Timeout period of 8 cycles 0x01, 1KCYCLES - Timeout period of 1024 cycles 0x02, 16KCYCLES - Timeout period of 16384 cycles 0x03, 32KCYCLES - Timeout period of 32768 cycles

field.name: CLKOUTSEL1

field.name: BAND
field.description: HFRCO Band Select - Value, Description 0x00, 1MHZ - 1 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x01, 7MHZ - 7 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x02, 11MHZ - 11 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x03, 14MHZ - 14 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x04, 21MHZ - 21 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x05, 28MHZ - 28 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band.

field.name: BAND

NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x02, 7MHZ - 7 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x03, 1MHZ - 1 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x06, 28MHZ - 28 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band. 0x07, 21MHZ - 21 MHz. NOTE: Also set the TUNING value (bits 7:0) when changing band.

field.name: LFA

field.name: SCANMODE
field.description: Configure scan mode - Value, Description 0x00, PERIODIC - A new scan is started each time the period counter overflows 0x01, ONESHOT - A single scan is performed when START in CMD is set 0x02, PRS - Pulse on PRS channel

field.name: PRSSEL
field.description: Scan start PRS select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input

field.name: SCANCONF
field.description: Select scan configuration - Value, Description 0x00, DIRMAP - The channel configuration register registers used are directly mapped to the channel number. 0x01, INVMAP - The channel configuration register registers used are CHX+8_CONF for channels 0-7 and CHX-8_CONF for channels 8-15. 0x02, TOGGLE - The channel configuration register registers used toggles between CHX_CONF and CHX+8_CONF when channel x triggers 0x03, DECDEF - The decoder state defines the CONF registers to be used.

field.name: BUFIDL

field.name: DMAWU
field.description: DMA wakeup from EM2 - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - No DMA wakeup from EM2 0x01, BUFDATAV - DMA wakeup from EM2 when data is valid in the result buffer 0x02, BUFLEVEL - DMA wakeup from EM2 when the result buffer is full/halffull depending on BUFIDL configuration

field.name: AUXPRESC
field.description: Prescaling factor for high frequency timer - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/1 0x01, DIV2 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/2 0x02, DIV4 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/4 0x03, DIV8 - High frequency timer is clocked with AUXHFRCO/8

field.name: LFPRESC

field.name: PCPRESC
field.description: Period counter prescaling - Value, Description 0x00, DIV1 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/1 0x01, DIV2 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/2 0x02, DIV4 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/4 0x03, DIV8 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/8 0x04, DIV16 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/16 0x05, DIV32 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/32 0x06, DIV64 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/64 0x07, DIV128 - The period counter clock frequency is LFACLKLESENSE/128

field.name: DACCH0CONV
field.description: DAC channel 0 conversion mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control DAC CH0. 0x01, CONTINUOUS - DAC channel 0 is driven in continuous mode. 0x02, SAMPLEHOLD - DAC channel 0 is driven in sample hold mode. 0x03, SAMPLEOFF - DAC channel 0 is driven in sample off mode.

field.name: DACCH1CONV
field.description: DAC channel 1 conversion mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control DAC CH1. 0x01, CONTINUOUS - DAC channel 1 is driven in continuous mode. 0x02, SAMPLEHOLD - DAC channel 1 is driven in sample hold mode. 0x03, SAMPLEOFF - DAC channel 1 is driven in sample off mode.

field.name: DACCH0OUT
field.description: DAC channel 0 output mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - DAC CH0 output to pin and ACMP/ADC disabled 0x01, PIN - DAC CH0 output to pin enabled, output to ADC and ACMP disabled 0x02, ADCACMP - DAC CH0 output to pin disabled, output to ADC and ACMP enabled 0x03, PINADCACMP - DAC CH0 output to pin, ADC, and ACMP enabled.

field.name: DACCH1OUT
field.description: DAC channel 1 output mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - DAC CH1 output to pin and ACMP/ADC disabled 0x01, PIN - DAC CH1 output to pin enabled, output to ADC and ACMP disabled 0x02, ADCACMP - DAC CH1 output to pin disabled, output to ADC and ACMP enabled 0x03, PINADCACMP - DAC CH1 output to pin, ADC, and ACMP enabled.

field.name: ACMP0MODE
field.description: ACMP0 mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control ACMP0 0x01, MUX - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) of ACMP0 0x02, MUXTHRES - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) and the threshold value (VDDLEVEL) of ACMP0

field.name: ACMP1MODE
field.description: ACMP1 mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - LESENSE does not control ACMP1 0x01, MUX - LESENSE controls the input mux (POSSEL) of ACMP1 0x02, MUXTHRES - LESENSE controls the input mux and the threshold value (VDDLEVEL) of ACMP1

field.name: WARMUPMODE
field.description: ACMP and DAC duty cycle mode - Value, Description 0x00, NORMAL - The analog comparators and DAC are shut down when LESENSE is idle 0x01, KEEPACMPWARM - The analog comparators are kept powered up when LESENSE is idle 0x02, KEEPDACWARM - The DAC is kept powered up when LESENSE is idle 0x03, KEEPACMPDACWARM - The analog comparators and DAC are kept powered up when LESENSE is idle

field.description: Configure transition action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Do not count 0x01, UP - Count up 0x01, PRS0 - Generate pulse on PRS0 0x02, PRS1 - Generate pulse on PRS1 0x02, DOWN - Count down 0x03, PRS01 - Generate pulse on PRS0 and PRS1 0x04, PRS2 - Generate pulse on PRS2 0x05, PRS02 - Generate pulse on PRS0 and PRS2 0x05, UPANDPRS2 - Count up and generate pulse on PRS2. 0x06, PRS12 - Generate pulse on PRS1 and PRS2 0x06, DOWNANDPRS2 - Count down and generate pulse on PRS2. 0x07, PRS012 - Generate pulse on PRS0, PRS1 and PRS2

field.name: SETIF
field.description: Enable interrupt generation - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No interrupt is generated 0x01, LEVEL - Set interrupt flag if the sensor triggers. 0x02, POSEDGE - Set interrupt flag on positive edge on the sensor state 0x03, NEGEDGE - Set interrupt flag on negative edge on the sensor state

field.name: DRIVEMODE
field.description: Drive Mode Select - Value, Description 0x00, STANDARD - 6 mA drive current 0x01, LOWEST - 0.5 mA drive current 0x02, HIGH - 20 mA drive current 0x03, LOW - 2 mA drive current

field.name: MODE0
field.description: Pin 0 Mode - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLED - Input disabled. Pullup if DOUT is set. 0x01, INPUT - Input enabled. Filter if DOUT is set 0x02, INPUTPULL - Input enabled. DOUT determines pull direction 0x03, INPUTPULLFILTER - Input enabled with filter. DOUT determines pull direction 0x04, PUSHPULL - Push-pull output 0x05, PUSHPULLDRIVE - Push-pull output with drive-strength set by DRIVEMODE 0x06, WIREDOR - Wired-or output 0x07, WIREDORPULLDOWN - Wired-or output with pull-down 0x08, WIREDAND - Open-drain output 0x09, WIREDANDFILTER - Open-drain output with filter 0x0A, WIREDANDPULLUP - Open-drain output with pullup 0x0B, WIREDANDPULLUPFILTER - Open-drain output with filter and pullup 0x0C, WIREDANDDRIVE - Open-drain output with drive-strength set by DRIVEMODE 0x0D, WIREDANDDRIVEFILTER - Open-drain output with filter and drive-strength set by DRIVEMODE 0x0E, WIREDANDDRIVEPULLUP - Open-drain output with pullup and drive-strength set by DRIVEMODE 0x0F, WIREDANDDRIVEPULLUPFILTER - Open-drain output with filter, pullup and drive-strength set by DRIVEMODE

field.name: ICEVCTRL
field.description: Input Capture Event Control - Value, Description 0x00, EVERYEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every capture 0x01, EVERYSECONDEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every second capture 0x02, RISING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on rising edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH) 0x03, FALLING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on falling edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

field.name: CMOA
field.description: Compare Match Output Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on compare match 0x01, TOGGLE - Toggle output on compare match 0x02, CLEAR - Clear output on compare match 0x03, SET - Set output on compare match

field.name: COFOA
field.description: Counter Overflow Output Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on counter overflow 0x01, TOGGLE - Toggle output on counter overflow 0x02, CLEAR - Clear output on counter overflow 0x03, SET - Set output on counter overflow

field.name: CUFOA
field.description: Counter Underflow Output Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on counter underflow 0x01, TOGGLE - Toggle output on counter underflow 0x02, CLEAR - Clear output on counter underflow 0x03, SET - Set output on counter underflow

field.name: PRSSEL
field.description: Compare/Capture Channel PRS Input Channel Selection - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input

field.name: ICEDGE
field.description: Input Capture Edge Select - Value, Description 0x00, RISING - Rising edges detected 0x01, FALLING - Falling edges detected 0x02, BOTH - Both edges detected 0x03, NONE - No edge detection, signal is left as it is

field.name: ICEVCTRL
field.description: Input Capture Event Control - Value, Description 0x00, EVERYEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every capture 0x01, EVERYSECONDEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every second capture 0x02, RISING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on rising edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH) 0x03, FALLING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on falling edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

field.name: MODE
field.description: CC Channel Mode - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Compare/Capture channel turned off 0x01, INPUTCAPTURE - Input capture 0x02, OUTPUTCOMPARE - Output compare 0x03, PWM - Pulse-Width Modulation

field.name: CMOA
field.description: Compare Match Output Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on compare match 0x01, TOGGLE - Toggle output on compare match 0x02, CLEAR - Clear output on compare match 0x03, SET - Set output on compare match

field.name: COFOA
field.description: Counter Overflow Output Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on counter overflow 0x01, TOGGLE - Toggle output on counter overflow 0x02, CLEAR - Clear output on counter overflow 0x03, SET - Set output on counter overflow

field.name: CUFOA
field.description: Counter Underflow Output Action - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - No action on counter underflow 0x01, TOGGLE - Toggle output on counter underflow 0x02, CLEAR - Clear output on counter underflow 0x03, SET - Set output on counter underflow

field.name: PRSSEL
field.description: Compare/Capture Channel PRS Input Channel Selection - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input

field.name: ICEDGE
field.description: Input Capture Edge Select - Value, Description 0x00, RISING - Rising edges detected 0x01, FALLING - Falling edges detected 0x02, BOTH - Both edges detected 0x03, NONE - No edge detection, signal is left as it is

field.name: ICEVCTRL
field.description: Input Capture Event Control - Value, Description 0x00, EVERYEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every capture 0x01, EVERYSECONDEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every second capture 0x02, RISING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on rising edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH) 0x03, FALLING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on falling edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

field.name: PRSSEL
field.description: Compare/Capture Channel PRS Input Channel Selection - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected as input 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected as input 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected as input 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected as input 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected as input 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected as input 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected as input 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected as input

field.name: ICEDGE
field.description: Input Capture Edge Select - Value, Description 0x00, RISING - Rising edges detected 0x01, FALLING - Falling edges detected 0x02, BOTH - Both edges detected 0x03, NONE - No edge detection, signal is left as it is

field.name: ICEVCTRL
field.description: Input Capture Event Control - Value, Description 0x00, EVERYEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every capture 0x01, EVERYSECONDEDGE - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on every second capture 0x02, RISING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on rising edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH) 0x03, FALLING - PRS output pulse, interrupt flag and DMA request set on falling edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

field.name: OVS
field.description: Oversampling - Value, Description 0x00, X16 - Regular UART mode with 16X oversampling in asynchronous mode 0x01, X8 - Double speed with 8X oversampling in asynchronous mode 0x02, X6 - 6X oversampling in asynchronous mode 0x03, X4 - Quadruple speed with 4X oversampling in asynchronous mode

field.name: CSMA
field.description: Action On Slave-Select In Master Mode

field.name: TXDELAY
field.description: TX Delay Transmission - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Frames are transmitted immediately 0x01, SINGLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by a single baud period 0x02, DOUBLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by two baud periods 0x03, TRIPLE - Transmission of new frames are delayed by three baud periods

field.name: AUTOTX
field.description: Always Transmit When RX Not Full

field.name: DATABITS
field.description: Data-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x01, FOUR - Each frame contains 4 data bits 0x02, FIVE - Each frame contains 5 data bits 0x03, SIX - Each frame contains 6 data bits 0x04, SEVEN - Each frame contains 7 data bits 0x05, EIGHT - Each frame contains 8 data bits 0x06, NINE - Each frame contains 9 data bits 0x07, TEN - Each frame contains 10 data bits 0x08, ELEVEN - Each frame contains 11 data bits 0x09, TWELVE - Each frame contains 12 data bits 0x0A, THIRTEEN - Each frame contains 13 data bits 0x0B, FOURTEEN - Each frame contains 14 data bits 0x0C, FIFTEEN - Each frame contains 15 data bits 0x0D, SIXTEEN - Each frame contains 16 data bits

field.name: PARITY
field.description: Parity-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Parity bits are not used 0x02, EVEN - Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware. 0x03, ODD - Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

field.name: STOPBITS
field.description: Stop-Bit Mode - Value, Description 0x00, HALF - The transmitter generates a half stop bit. Stop-bits are not verified by receiver 0x01, ONE - One stop bit is generated and verified 0x02, ONEANDAHALF - The transmitter generates one and a half stop bit. The receiver verifies the first stop bit 0x03, TWO - The transmitter generates two stop bits. The receiver checks the first stop-bit only

field.name: TSEL
field.description: Trigger PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected

field.name: TXBDRIGHT
field.description: TX Buffer Expects Double Right Data

field.name: TXBSRIGHT
field.description: TX Buffer Expects Single Right Data

register.description: RX Buffer Double Data Extended Register

register.description: RX Buffer Data Extended Peek Register

field.name: IRPW
field.description: IrDA TX Pulse Width - Value, Description 0x00, ONE - IrDA pulse width is 1/16 for OVS=0 and 1/8 for OVS=1 0x01, TWO - IrDA pulse width is 2/16 for OVS=0 and 2/8 for OVS=1 0x02, THREE - IrDA pulse width is 3/16 for OVS=0 and 3/8 for OVS=1 0x03, FOUR - IrDA pulse width is 4/16 for OVS=0 and 4/8 for OVS=1

field.name: IRPRSSEL
field.description: IrDA PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3

field.name: RXPRSSEL
field.description: RX PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected

field.name: DMASPLIT
field.description: Separate DMA Request For Left/Right Data

field.name: FORMAT
field.description: I2S Word Format - Value, Description 0x00, W32D32 - 32-bit word, 32-bit data 0x01, W32D24M - 32-bit word, 32-bit data with 8 lsb masked 0x02, W32D24 - 32-bit word, 24-bit data 0x03, W32D16 - 32-bit word, 16-bit data 0x04, W32D8 - 32-bit word, 8-bit data 0x05, W16D16 - 16-bit word, 16-bit data 0x06, W16D8 - 16-bit word, 8-bit data 0x07, W8D8 - 8-bit word, 8-bit data

field.description: Set Multi-Processor Address Frame Interrupt Flag

field.name: MPAF
field.description: Clear Multi-Processor Address Frame Interrupt Flag

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3

field.name: RXPRSSEL
field.description: RX PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected

field.name: REPMODE
field.description: Repeat Mode - Value, Description 0x00, FREE - When started, the LETIMER counts down until it is stopped by software. 0x01, ONESHOT - The counter counts REP0 times. When REP0 reaches zero, the counter stops. 0x02, BUFFERED - The counter counts REP0 times. If REP1 has been written, it is loaded into REP0 when REP0 reaches zero. Else the counter stops 0x03, DOUBLE - Both REP0 and REP1 are decremented when the LETIMER wraps around. The LETIMER counts until both REP0 and REP1 are zero

field.name: UFOA0
field.description: Underflow Output Action 0 - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - LETn_O0 is held at its idle value as defined by OPOL0. 0x01, TOGGLE - LETn_O0 is toggled on CNT underflow. 0x02, PULSE - LETn_O0 is held active for one LFACLKLETIMER0 clock cycle on CNT underflow. The output then returns to its idle value as defined by OPOL0. 0x03, PWM - LETn_O0 is set idle on CNT underflow, and active on compare match with COMP1

field.name: UFOA1
field.description: Underflow Output Action 1 - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - LETn_O1 is held at its idle value as defined by OPOL1. 0x01, TOGGLE - LETn_O1 is toggled on CNT underflow. 0x02, PULSE - LETn_O1 is held active for one LFACLKLETIMER0 clock cycle on CNT underflow. The output then returns to its idle value as defined by OPOL1. 0x03, PWM - LETn_O1 is set idle on CNT underflow, and active on compare match with COMP1

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3

field.name: MODE
field.description: Mode Select - Value, Description 0x00, DISABLE - The module is disabled 0x01, OVSSINGLE - Single input LFACLK oversampling mode (available in EM0-EM2) 0x02, EXTCLKSINGLE - Externally clocked single input counter mode (available in EM0-EM3) 0x03, EXTCLKQUAD - Externally clocked quadrature decoder mode (available in EM0-EM3)

field.name: CNTEV
field.description: Controls when the counter counts - Value, Description 0x00, BOTH - Counts up on up-count and down on down-count events 0x01, UP - Only counts up on up-count events 0x02, DOWN - Only counts down on down-count events 0x03, NONE - Never counts

field.name: AUXCNTEV
field.description: Controls when the auxillary counter counts - Value, Description 0x00, NONE - Never counts 0x01, UP - Counts up on up-count events 0x02, DOWN - Counts up on down-count events 0x03, BOTH - Counts up on both up-count and down-count events

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Select location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Select location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Select location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Select location 3

field.name: S0PRSSEL
field.description: S0IN PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected

field.name: S1PRSSEL
field.description: S1IN PRS Channel Select - Value, Description 0x00, PRSCH0 - PRS Channel 0 selected 0x01, PRSCH1 - PRS Channel 1 selected 0x02, PRSCH2 - PRS Channel 2 selected 0x03, PRSCH3 - PRS Channel 3 selected 0x04, PRSCH4 - PRS Channel 4 selected 0x05, PRSCH5 - PRS Channel 5 selected 0x06, PRSCH6 - PRS Channel 6 selected 0x07, PRSCH7 - PRS Channel 7 selected

field.name: CLHR
field.description: Clock Low High Ratio - Value, Description 0x00, STANDARD - The ratio is 4:4. Both low and high periods lasts 4 prescaled clock cycles 0x01, ASYMMETRIC - The ratio is 6:3. Low period lasts 6 and high period lasts 4 prescaled clock cycles 0x02, FAST - The ratio is 11:6. Low period lasts 16 and high period lasts 9 prescaled clock cycles

field.name: BITO
field.description: Bus Idle Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout.

field.name: GIBITO
field.description: Go Idle on Bus Idle Timeout

field.name: CLTO
field.description: Clock Low Timeout - Value, Description 0x00, OFF - Timeout disabled 0x01, 40PCC - Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout. 0x02, 80PCC - Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout. 0x03, 160PCC - Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout. 0x04, 320PPC - Timeout after 320 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 400us timeout. 0x05, 1024PPC - Timeout after 1024 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 1280us timeout.

field.name: STATE
field.description: Transmission State - Value, Description 0x00, IDLE - No transmission is being performed. 0x01, WAIT - Waiting for idle. Will send a start condition as soon as the bus is idle. 0x02, START - Start transmitted or received 0x03, ADDR - Address transmitted or received 0x04, ADDRACK - Address ack/nack transmitted or received 0x05, DATA - Data transmitted or received 0x06, DATAACK - Data ack/nack transmitted or received

field.name: NACK
field.description: Set Not Acknowledge Received Interrupt Flag

field.name: TXOF
field.description: Set Transmit Buffer Overflow Interrupt Flag

field.name: RXUF
field.description: Set Receive Buffer Underflow Interrupt Flag

field.name: BITO
field.description: Set Bus Idle Timeout Interrupt Flag

field.name: NACK
field.description: Clear Not Acknowledge Received Interrupt Flag

field.name: TXOF
field.description: Clear Transmit Buffer Overflow Interrupt Flag

field.name: RXUF
field.description: Clear Receive Buffer Underflow Interrupt Flag

field.name: BITO
field.description: Clear Bus Idle Timeout Interrupt Flag

field.name: LOCATION
field.description: I/O Location - Value, Description 0x00, LOC0 - Location 0 0x01, LOC1 - Location 1 0x02, LOC2 - Location 2 0x03, LOC3 - Location 3

field.name: WARMUPMODE
field.description: Warm-up Mode - Value, Description 0x00, NORMAL - ADC is shut down after each conversion 0x01, FASTBG - Bandgap references do not need warm up, but have reduced accuracy. 0x02, KEEPSCANREFWARM - Reference selected for scan mode is kept warm. 0x03, KEEPADCWARM - ADC is kept warmed up and scan reference is kept warm

field.name: LPFMODE
field.description: Low Pass Filter Mode - Value, Description 0x00, BYPASS - No filter or decoupling capacitor 0x01, DECAP - On chip decoupling capacitor selected 0x02, RCFILT - On chip RC filter selected

field.name: OVSRSEL
field.description: Oversample Rate Select - Value, Description 0x00, X2 - 2 samples for each conversion result 0x01, X4 - 4 samples for each conversion result 0x02, X8 - 8 samples for each conversion result 0x03, X16 - 16 samples for each conversion result 0x04, X32 - 32 samples for each conversion result 0x05, X64 - 64 samples for each conversion result 0x06, X128 - 128 samples for each conversion result 0x07, X256 - 256 samples for each conversion result 0x08, X512 - 512 samples for each conversion result 0x09, X1024 - 1024 samples for each conversion result 0x0A, X2048 - 2048 samples for each conversion result 0x0B, X4096 - 4096 samples for each conversion result

field.name: SCANDATASRC
field.description: Scan Data Source - Value, Description 0x00, CH0 - Single ended mode: SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH0. Differential mode: SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH0-ADCn_CH1 0x01, CH1 - Single ended mode: SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH1. Differential mode: SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH2_ADCn_CH3 0x02, CH2 - Single ended mode: SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH2. Differential mode: SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH4-ADCn_CH5 0x03, CH3 - Single ended mode: SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH3. Differential mode: SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH6-ADCn_CH7 0x04, CH4 - SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH4 0x05, CH5 - SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH5 0x06, CH6 - SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH6 0x07, CH7 - SCANDATA result originates from ADCn_CH7

field.description: Single Sample Resolution Select - Value, Description 0x00, 12BIT - 12-bit resolution 0x01, 8BIT - 8-bit resolution 0x02, 6BIT - 6-bit resolution 0x03, OVS - Oversampling enabled. Oversampling rate is set in OVSRSEL
